tasks.task: Assembling a solar-powered drip irrigation system using recyclable materials
subtasks: Obtaining a 1-liter container free of labels
Cutting the 1-liter container at the specified line
Ensuring safety by relocating children during cutting activities
Acquiring a 2-liter bottle free of labels
Cutting the 2-liter bottle at the specified line
Installing the irrigation system near plants, avoiding root structures
Inserting the water-filled 1-liter container into the 2-liter bottle
Positioning the top part of the system to enable water evaporation and condensation
Ensuring the irrigation system complements regular watering rather than replacing it

tasks.task: Operating the solar-powered drip irrigation system
subtasks: Monitoring plant moisture needs during hot weather
Checking the irrigation system's water level and replenishing as needed
Positioning the system over plants while leaving the cap on to prevent water absorption
Watering additional nearby plants with any excess water

tasks.task: Constructing and using a solar-powered drip irrigation system made from recyclable materials
subtasks: Collecting and preparing the necessary recyclable containers
Cutting the containers to the correct measurements
Positioning the system near the plants for optimal water distribution
Monitoring the plant's watering needs and adjusting the system accordingly
